availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Percival "Pierce" Butler Hawkins (Bowling Green | Col. 11th KY Inf)

body.p: Bowling Green, Kentucky, attorney, teacher, and politician. Spotsylvania County, Virginia, native. Married to Jane Frances Hall Hawkins in Warren County on December 9, 1841. Father of A. E. Hawkins, Mary Bell Hawkins, Jane F. Hawkins, Nannie M. Hawkins, and Joseph Hawkins. Attorney in Warren County in 1850. Owned ten enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Member of the House of Representatives of the Commonwealth of Kentucky in 1850 and from 1863 to 1865. Teacher in Warren County in 1860. Owned ten enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Served in the 11th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment as colonel from November 11, 1861 to June 25, 1863. Commissioner of the Board of Enrollment of the 3rd Judicial District of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from July 27, 1863 to November 12, 1863 and from March 28, 1864 to August 22, 1864. Commissioned colonel of the 1st Regiment Capital Guards on July 11, 1864.
